summary: The U.S. is experiencing a shortage of teachers—a problem that worsened during the COVID-19 pandemic . Teacher shortages are more prevalent in: western states rural and urban communities high-poverty communities certain subject areas, including foreign languages, physical science, and special education The Department of Education introduced its vision in the summer of 2022 for "Supporting and Elevating the Teaching Profession." title: K-12 Education: Education Should Assess Its Efforts to Address Teacher Shortages
